qas.question: What is the oldest way to study migration?
Since when have swans been marked?
Who was scientific ringing pioneered by?
What are other forms of studying migration?

context: Bird migration routes have been studied by a variety of techniques including the oldest, <a0_0>marking<a0_0/>. Swans have been marked with <a1_0>a nick on the beak<a1_0/> since about <a2_0>1560<a2_0/> in England. Scientific ringing was pioneered by <a3_0>Hans Christian Cornelius Mortensen<a3_0/> in 1899. Other techniques include <a4_0>radar and satellite tracking<a4_0/>.
